What many don’t know is that common ingredients used by food manufacturers, contain processed free glutamic acid (the harmful component of monosodium glutamate) that causes these reactions. It’s important to know that MSG stands for ALL processed glutamic acid, not just monosodium glutamate. Glutamic acid found in unadulterated protein does not cause adverse reactions. To cause adverse reactions, the glutamic acid must have been processed/manufactured or come from protein that has been fermented.
